content:
• Wednesday, January 9, 2013
  • ROVI

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) -6.3% AH after establishing 2013 revenue guidance of $630M-$660M and EPS...

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) -6.3% AH after establishing 2013 revenue guidance of $630M-$660M and EPS guidance of $1.90-$2.20 ahead of a CES investor presentation. The numbers are mostly below a consensus of $683.8M and $2.20. IP licensing revenue is expected to grow 15% in 2013 to $315M, and opex/cost of goods sold less than 1% to $356.5M. Rovi rallied last week after announcing it's looking to sell its money-losing Entertainment Store unit.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • TXI

    Texas Industries (NYSE:TXI): FQ2 EPS of -$0.4 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $167.6M (+14.7% Y/Y)...

    Texas Industries (NYSE:TXI): FQ2 EPS of -$0.4 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $167.6M (+14.7% Y/Y) beats by $5.94M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • VOXX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VOXX +15%. NEWL +9%. SQNM +6%. PSMT +6%. XCO +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VOXX +15%. NEWL +9%. SQNM +6%. PSMT +6%. XCO +6%.
    After-hours top losers: QUIK -9%. RT -9%. HAFC -7%. NKTR -7%. HALO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX) now +17% AH following its FQ3 beat. Among other things, sales...

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX) now +17% AH following its FQ3 beat. Among other things, sales were boosted by demand for headphones and wireless speakers, as well as rear-seat entertainment systems for Ford and Nissan vehicles. The electronics brand holding company posted a gross margin of 28.8%, down 10 bps Y/Y but ahead of internal forecasts thanks to sales growth and a favorable mix. CC at 10AM ET tomorrow (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • QUIK

    QuickLogic (NASDAQ:QUIK) -9.1% AH after warning it expects to report Q4 revenue of $3.1M, below...

    QuickLogic (NASDAQ:QUIK) -9.1% AH after warning it expects to report Q4 revenue of $3.1M, below prior guidance of $3.4M (+/- 10%). No explanation is given for the shortfall. Bigger rival Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) lowered its guidance last month. Altera, Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX), and Lattice Semi (NASDAQ:LSCC) could trade lower following the warning.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • HLF

    News of the SEC's investigation into Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) weighed on other multi-level marketers...

    News of the SEC's investigation into Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) weighed on other multi-level marketers going into the close. Shares of skin care firm NuSkin (NUS -3.6%), Usana Health (USNA -1.9%) and Blyth (BTH -1%) all took a turn south after the announcement. HLF will present its case to investors at its meeting tomorrow in New York. (Tune in Tommorow via Webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $243M (+17.5% Y/Y)...

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ3 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.19. Revenue of $243M (+17.5% Y/Y) beats by $11.M. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • CALL

    magicJack Vocaltec (CALL -11.5%) closes with giant losses after Copperfield Research issues a...

    magicJack Vocaltec (CALL -11.5%) closes with giant losses after Copperfield Research issues a report taking aim at the company's accounting and trustworthiness. Among other things, Copperfield accuses magicJack of overstating revenue, earnings, and cash flow in earnings releases relative to SEC filings, and of using put option trades and other questionable investments to inflate earnings. It also notes CEO Dan Borislow has been sued for securities fraud in the past, and has sold shares after using them as collateral against personal debt. (SA Instablog)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +3.5%) defends the safety of its 787 Dreamliner after three incidents in three days...

    Boeing (BA +3.5%) defends the safety of its 787 Dreamliner after three incidents in three days (I, II, III), expressing "extreme confidence” in the plane. Analysts also have ridden to the rescue today: Citi says the incidents "do not signal grave issues" with the Dreamliner's long-term prospects, and Oppenheimer sees the issues as ordinary ‘teething’ problems "magnified by the 787’s media glow."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.5%) shares spike higher on heavy volume after news of J.P. Morgan's...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.5%) shares spike higher on heavy volume after news of J.P. Morgan's two-notch upgrade to Overweight from Underweight.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 11 Comments
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -3.9%) finds a place on David Trainer's list of "most dangerous...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -3.9%) finds a place on David Trainer's list of "most dangerous stocks" because ugly balance sheet numbers - notably $313M in accumulated asset write-downs and 850M-plus in deferred tax liabilities - could send shares tumbling to $25. COG’s current share place is justified only if it can grow 20% compounded annually for the next two decades, he adds.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • HLF

    In his Q4 letter to investors, Third Point's Dan Loeb outlines his thesis for taking a stake in...

    In his Q4 letter to investors, Third Point's Dan Loeb outlines his thesis for taking a stake in Herbalife (NYSE:HLF). Loeb points out that the research his firm conducted showed no evidence of any pyramid scheme, and the beating the stock took at the hands of Ackman created an attractive entry point to buy the shares. By applying a modest 10-12x earnings multiple, Loeb suggests the stock's worth between $55 - 68 per share - translating to 40% - 70% upside from current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • DHR

    Danaher (DHR +4.1%) says it expects to exceed Q4 profit and revenue forecasts, pointing to...

    Danaher (DHR +4.1%) says it expects to exceed Q4 profit and revenue forecasts, pointing to "broad-based" growth across its business. Previously announced EPS guidance was for between $0.80 and $0.85. Street estimates are for an EPS of $0.83.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +2.9%) has rallied following positive comments from Pac Crest. The...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +2.9%) has rallied following positive comments from Pac Crest. The firm thinks the cloud HR software vendor will post a strong Q4, and is benefiting from industry consolidation (I, II) and its Recruiting Cloud product (launched in March). Shares jumped in November following Cornerstone's Q3 report. Pac Crest is also positive on ExactTarget (ET-OLD +2.2%) going into its Q4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVLT

    This is probably a sign of good relative strength: CommVault (CVLT +4.1%) has rallied today even...

    This is probably a sign of good relative strength: CommVault (CVLT +4.1%) has rallied today even though Goldman downgraded shares this morning on valuation grounds. With investors confident about CommVault's ability to continue grabbing enterprise backup storage share form the likes of Symantec and EMC, shares are within striking distance of their all-time high of $72.93, and currently trade at 47x estimated FY14 (ends March '14) EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • CRK

    Global Hunter says it's getting more conservative with growth expectations for the year at...

    Global Hunter says it's getting more conservative with growth expectations for the year at Comstock Resources (CRK -8.6%) after reviewing the oil and gas producer's 2013 capital expenditure budget. The firm sees CRK's results at the low end of consensus for next year, and revises its price target and total oil production estimate downward.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CTIC

    After rising nearly 25% yesterday on big volume, shares of Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -11%) give...

    After rising nearly 25% yesterday on big volume, shares of Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -11%) give back a big chunk today. The stock has been volatile over the past few sessions, largely trading in tandem with big moves in competitor Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -11%), who announced favorable news on Mondary of its review of data on its experimental cancer drug bavituximab, saying it wasn't comprimised.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSL

    Solar stocks are soaring after China's announcement yesterday that it would seek to double solar...

    Solar stocks are soaring after China's announcement yesterday that it would seek to double solar installations to 10 GW, but analysts worry the stocks have moved too far too fast. While seeing the measures as positive, Nomura warns the stocks have rallied 50-100% in the last month and have "more than fully captured the upside." Today: TSL +11.3%, STP +8.4%, LDK +8.2%, YGE +7.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (QCOM +1.1%), Skyworks (SWKS +2.9%), and Avago (AVGO +1.8%) are ticking higher...

    Qualcomm (QCOM +1.1%), Skyworks (SWKS +2.9%), and Avago (AVGO +1.8%) are ticking higher following bullish coverage launches (I, II, III) from Topeka. The firm sees Qualcomm continuing to gain baseband chip share and consider fears of vertical integration overstated; thinks Skyworks will keep expanding its lineup beyond power amplifiers; and believes the sale of  phones supporting numerous 4G bands will benefit Avago's BAW filter business. Meanwhile, Qualcomm's surreal CES keynote, replete with Big Bird and Maroon 5, continues to make waves.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • SHPG

    A federal court has thrown out a lawsuit brought by ViroPharma (VPHM +0.2%) against the FDA that...

    A federal court has thrown out a lawsuit brought by ViroPharma (VPHM +0.2%) against the FDA that sought to stop the agency from approving three generic versions of the company's antibiotic Vancocin, saying the drug developer failed to produce any new evidence. Vancocin, a treatment for Clostridium difficile and other gastrointestinal infections, accounted for about $289M in VPHM’s sales in 2011, and constitutes about half of its revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • HCSG

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +2.5%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy at Benchmark, citing...

    Healthcare Services Group (HCSG +2.5%) moves up on an upgrade to Buy at Benchmark, citing expectations for earnings growth, better visibility on its dividend tax rate and the likelihood that it will garner the Worker Opportunity Tax Credit in 2013. The firm also ups its price target to $27 from $23.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • GTXI

    GTx Inc. (GTXI +5.7%) regains some lost traction from yesterday after the company reported that...

    GTx Inc. (GTXI +5.7%) regains some lost traction from yesterday after the company reported that its drug, enobosarm, which is indicated for the prevention and treatment of muscle wasting in patients with non-small cell lung cancer, has been given a Fast Track designation by the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • ININ

    Midday top 10 gainers: ININ +19%. KGJI +15%. SINO +14%. ZIPR +14%. CTC +14%. ROSG-OLD +13%. CSIQ...

    Midday top 10 gainers: ININ +19%. KGJI +15%. SINO +14%. ZIPR +14%. CTC +14%. ROSG-OLD +13%. CSIQ +13%. TSL +13%. SAAS +12%. SMED +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: SCHS -29%. PPHM -12%. PTEK -11%. CTIC -11%. OTCQB:DLGC -11%. MG -11%. ZA -10%. DYSL -9%. APOL -9%. CRK -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (MT -3.8%) has submitted a bid to ThyssenKrupp (OTCPK:TYEKF) reflecting its...

    ArcelorMittal (MT -3.8%) has submitted a bid to ThyssenKrupp (OTCPK:TYEKF) reflecting its interest in purchasing the German steelmaker's steel plant in Alabama, MT's CFO says. A successful bid would strengthen MT's presence in the U.S. automotive sector while stemming losses at Krupp, which suffered huge cost overruns and massive losses during the ramp-up of the Alabama plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • ATHN

    Shares of athenahealth (ATHN +3.8%) hold on to gains made ahead of its presentation this morning...

    Shares of athenahealth (ATHN +3.8%) hold on to gains made ahead of its presentation this morning at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference. In its slide presentation it reiterated that it targets 30% annual revenue growth over the next five years, and still projects incremental improvement Y/Y in its gross margin rate after the service line reinvestment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (GEOY +7.8%) and DigitalGlobe (DGI +5.2%) jump on news the DOJ has approved the...

    GeoEye (GEOY +7.8%) and DigitalGlobe (DGI +5.2%) jump on news the DOJ has approved the companies' merger, which will create a dominant provider of satellite imagery services for the U.S. government. Though FCC and NOAA approval are still pending, DigitalGlobe says it expects the merger to close by Jan. 31. GeoEye shareholders approved the deal in December. (Indian railway deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • INVA

    Theravance (THRX +3.2%) and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +0.1%) have submitted a regulatory application...

    Theravance (THRX +3.2%) and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +0.1%) have submitted a regulatory application to the E.U. for Anoro, an investigational combination medicine for patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. The companies submitted a regulatory application in the U.S. for the drug last December.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • FB

    For the first time in nearly 6 months, Facebook (FB +3.7%) is trading above $30/share. There's...

    For the first time in nearly 6 months, Facebook (FB +3.7%) is trading above $30/share. There's no specific reason for today's move, unless one counts an invitation for a Jan. 15 event that some think could feature a smartphone announcement. Shorts have been covering at a pretty rapid clip, and recent analyst commentary has featured plenty of bullish remarks about improving mobile monetization and the impact of new ad products. Shares are now up 54% since Facebook delivered its Q3 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 7 Comments
  • HOLX

    Hologic (HOLX +6%) gains after highlighting a new study published in the scientific journal...

    Hologic (HOLX +6%) gains after highlighting a new study published in the scientific journal Radiology, in which researchers using HOLX' 3D mammography technology in combination with a 2D mammogram found a significant increase in cancer detection rates, particularly for invasive cancers, and a simultaneous decrease in false-positive rates compared with 2D mammography alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold (EGO -1.6%) says its 2012 mining operations performed largely according to plan,...

    Eldorado Gold (EGO -1.6%) says its 2012 mining operations performed largely according to plan, with year-end production of ~659K oz. of gold at a higher-than-expected cash cost of $489/oz., largely due to higher production costs at its Efemcukuru mine. EGO expects 2013 production of 705K-760K oz. of gold with cash costs of $515-$530/oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +4.3%) moves up after saying it's received an equity milestone...

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +4.3%) moves up after saying it's received an equity milestone payment of 620K shares of common stock in newly public partner Retrophin, as partial payment for the license agreement of Retrophin's lead clinical candidate RE-021, a treatment for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis, which is a rare disease that attacks the kidney's filtering system. The shares issued represent about 7% of Retrophin's outstanding float.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY -2.5%) slip lower with concerns over Richard Schulze's ability to...

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY -2.5%) slip lower with concerns over Richard Schulze's ability to finalize a bid cropping up. It should be an eventful work for Best Buy with holiday sales due to be reported on Thursday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • GRMN

    Garmin (GRMN -2.9%) slips after Goldman reports management stated at CES it expects its 2013 PND...

    Garmin (GRMN -2.9%) slips after Goldman reports management stated at CES it expects its 2013 PND unit sales to decline at a rate in-line with the 15%-20% drop expected for the broader market. That's worse than Goldman's forecast for a 7% Garmin unit drop. Garmin has used CES to show off new Nuvi PND models and (more interestingly) the K2 automotive platform. K2 features, a 10" multi-touch PND/infotainment display, a 12" display that acts as an instrument cluster/notification center, steering wheel controls, and Bluetooth pairing. It probably won't come cheap.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO -2.4%) plans to shutter its 93,500 bbl/day Kapolei, Hawaii, refinery and convert it...

    Tesoro (TSO -2.4%) plans to shutter its 93,500 bbl/day Kapolei, Hawaii, refinery and convert it to an import, storage and distribution terminal after failing to sell it. TSO says it plans to take a one-time charge of $1-$1.10/share in Q4, and expects to realize $300M-$350M in cash by the end of 2013 on a reduction in working capital needs due to the conversion.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • CTXS

    Citrix (CTXS +2.7%) rallies after Jefferies upgrades shares to Buy. The firm says its "field...

    Citrix (CTXS +2.7%) rallies after Jefferies upgrades shares to Buy. The firm says its "field work" indicates PC virtualization projects (Citrix is the market leader here) remain a business priority; views analyst estimates as "undemanding," thinks there's "potential for better growth" in Citrix's data center business (includes server virtualization and IT/cloud management software); and notes the expansion of Citrix's desktop business beyond its traditional thin client/virtualization focus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • DISH

    "It's hard for me to imagine that what Dish wants is Clearwire . It could be a chess move to get...

    "It's hard for me to imagine that what Dish wants is Clearwire ... It could be a chess move to get a partnership with Sprint," opines Bernstein's Craig Moffett. Jefferies and Macquarie also think Dish's (DISH +2.1%) $3.30/share offer for Clearwire (CLWR +7.7%) is an attempt to cut a deal with Sprint (S -1.4%), long named as a potential 4G partner but currently in the midst of selling itself to SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF). Macquarie adds a $3.50-$3.75/share Sprint bid might be needed to get Dish and dissident shareholders to back down. PCS +1.8%. LEAP +0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM | 7 Comments
  • SMLP

    Summit Midstream Partners (SMLP -4.9%) is sharply lower in early trading after announcing the...

    Summit Midstream Partners (SMLP -4.9%) is sharply lower in early trading after announcing the acquisition of privately-held Bear Tracker Energy, which owns assets in service and under development in the Bakken shale and Three Forks formation in North Dakota and the Niobrara shale in Colorado, for $513M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF +3.5%) jump after resuming trading following a brief volatility halt on...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF +3.5%) jump after resuming trading following a brief volatility halt on the back of Third Point's announcement of a passive 8.24% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 7 Comments
  • LVLT

    Level 3 (LVLT -3.5%) opens lower following a downgrade to Neutral from D.A. Davidson. The firm...

    Level 3 (LVLT -3.5%) opens lower following a downgrade to Neutral from D.A. Davidson. The firm cites valuation, and a belief EMEA and wholesale sales were flat-to-down in Q4. Yesterday, Dan Rayburn reported Level 3 has won a CDN services deal with Apple to handle a share of its software downloads, including iOS/iTunes content, in the U.S. and Europe. The deal is said to be smaller than the one Apple has with Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA) jumps 11.7% after disclosing that preliminary 2012 revenues climbed 15%...

    NuVasive (NASDAQ:NUVA) jumps 11.7% after disclosing that preliminary 2012 revenues climbed 15% to $619M, above previous guidance of $601-606M and analyst consensus of $604.4M. NuVasive expects 2013 sales of $655M vs Street forecasts of $638.16M. "We anticipate that our market share taking strategy and momentum can be sustained in 2013," says CEO Alex Lukianov, who's due to present at the JPM Healthcare conference today. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • APOL

    It's a double-digit loss now for Apollo Group (APOL -11%) after its outlook for FY13 doesn't...

    It's a double-digit loss now for Apollo Group (APOL -11%) after its outlook for FY13 doesn't paint a pretty picture. As expected, sector peers are also taking it on the chin. Decliners: DV -6.5%, STRA -5.1%, CECO -2.8%, COCO -1.5%, ESI-OLD -3.9%, LOPE -2.1%, LINC -1.2%, EDMC -1.2%, BPI -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • ROST

    Shares of Ross Stores (ROST +1.2%) trade higher after Deutsche Bank comes in with an upgrade to...

    Shares of Ross Stores (ROST +1.2%) trade higher after Deutsche Bank comes in with an upgrade to Buy. Along with TJX Companies, the retailer seems to have landed in the sweet spot of retail between department stores and discounters.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD) soars 19% after saying that its miRview mets2 cancer...

    Rosetta Genomics (NASDAQ:ROSG-OLD) soars 19% after saying that its miRview mets2 cancer diagnostic test performed well in a study. miRview mets2 is able to identify the primary sites of secondary cancer tumors that routine testing is unable to. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM

  • U.S. stock futures start to wake up a bit after being fairly flat earlier, with the S&P...

    U.S. stock futures start to wake up a bit after being fairly flat earlier, with the S&P +0.1% and Dow +0.2%. Alcoa's (+2.75%) decent start to Q4 earnings season has been boosting sentiment at home and in Asia and Europe as well. The aluminum company's upbeat outlook "is encouraging because it suggests demand is picking up on a global scale," says economist Peter Cardillo. Later: EIA Petroleum Inventories
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Premarket gainers: ROSG-OLD +18%. NUVA +14%. GPN +8%. CLWR +7%. SKUL +7%.Losers: APOL -8%. XTEX...

    Premarket gainers: ROSG-OLD +18%. NUVA +14%. GPN +8%. CLWR +7%. SKUL +7%.
    Losers: APOL -8%. XTEX -6%. MT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • HA

    Bank of America downgrades Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA) to Underperform and lowers its price...

    Bank of America downgrades Hawaiian Holdings (NASDAQ:HA) to Underperform and lowers its price target on shares by 36% to $7. The firm notes that in Q4 business travel bookings accelerated for the carrier but leisure demand was sluggish. HA -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) pops 5.4% premarket on a Bloomberg report discussing takeover...

    Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) pops 5.4% premarket on a Bloomberg report discussing takeover speculation following a 66% ravaging of the shares since its July 2011 IPO.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM | 2 Comments
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) -5.1% premarket after announcing plans for a combined offering of common...

    ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) -5.1% premarket after announcing plans for a combined offering of common stock and mandatorily convertible subordinated notes to raise ~$3.5B; proceeds will be used to reduce debt. Also, the steel maker will restart one of its blast furnaces at its plant in Dunkerque, France, due to increased customer demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • DNN

    Denison Mining (NYSEMKT:DNN) +7.7% premarket after announcing significant increases in mineral...

    Denison Mining (NYSEMKT:DNN) +7.7% premarket after announcing significant increases in mineral resource estimates for its high grade Phoenix A and Phoenix B uranium deposits on its Wheeler River project in Saskatchewan. The total indicated mineral resource contains ~52.3M lbs. U3O8 based on ~152K metric tons of mineralization at an average grade of 15.6% U3O8.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM | 1 Comment

  • U.S. stock futures are flat and not joining the celebration seen in Asia and Europe earlier...

    U.S. stock futures are flat and not joining the celebration seen in Asia and Europe earlier following Alcoa's upbeat Q4 results. Europe's still mostly green but down from earlier highs. Dow +0.1%, S&P flat, Nasdaq -0.1%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London +0.3%, Paris flat, Frankfurt -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 AM

  • Asian and European shares are broadly higher after Alcoa provided a strong beginning to U.S....

    Asian and European shares are broadly higher after Alcoa provided a strong beginning to U.S. earnings season, predicting that the growth in global aluminum demand will accelerate. "Traders braced themselves for the start of an expected weak earnings season in the U.S.," says trader Jonathan Sudaria. Now they're "scaling back on the pessimism." Japan +0.7%, Hong Kong +0.5%, China flat, India -0.1%. EU Stoxx 50 +0.4%, London +0.4%, Paris +0.4%, Frankfurt +0.3%, Milan +1.1%, Madrid +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 AM
